item.title: Some contest programs
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

i wrote this a while ago too. it’s not the best but it worked.

bool is_valid_cc(const char *no) { int sum = 0, len = strlen(no), m2z = len % 2 == 0; for (int i = len - 1; i >= 0; i--) { int d = (no[i] - '0') * ((m2z ? i % 2 == 0 : i % 2 != 0) ? 2 : 1); sum += d > 9 ? d / 10 + d % 10 : d; } return sum % 10 == 0; }

Read full topic

item.title: Some contest programs
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:11, topic:541700”]I did the Luhn algorithm in JS a while ago:

function validateCard11(number) { return !(number.split('').reverse().reduce((a, b, i) => a + (+b && i % 2 ? b * 2 % 9 || 9 : +b), 0) % 10); }[/quote]

NICE!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Some contest programs
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:541700”]So is it like some low level competition where they dont expect you to be able to program a way to get the answer right 100%? Or do you have a small amount of time?

EDIT - I did the Luhn one as well, wild’s looked off…

public static boolean luhn(long value) { String sValue = Long.toString(value); // Only using this to get the length, there are better ways though int result = 0; for(int i = 0; i < sValue.length(); i++) { int digit = (int) ((value / Math.pow(10, i)) % 10); if(i % 2 == 1) { digit = ((digit * 2) % 10) + (digit > 4 ? 1 : 0); } result += digit; } return (result % 10) == 0; }[/quote]
Mine looked off because I don’t have a very good way of breaking down a formula. I wrote down everything that was required for the formula, and then just wrote it according to how I read it

Read full topic

So is it like some low level competition where they dont expect you to be able to program a way to get the answer right 100%? Or do you have a small amount of time?

EDIT - I did the Luhn one as well, wild’s looked off…

public static boolean luhn(long value) { String sValue = Long.toString(value); // Only using this to get the length, there are better ways though int result = 0; for(int i = 0; i < sValue.length(); i++) { int digit = (int) ((value / Math.pow(10, i)) % 10); if(i % 2 == 1) { digit = ((digit * 2) % 10) + (digit > 4 ? 1 : 0); } result += digit; } return (result % 10) == 0; }

item.title: Some contest programs
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

Its a competition.

Lets say the Answer is

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8

And the values that you produce based on the questions is

1
8
10
23
14
958
41
39

then you would get 20 points based on your result

if you get none of them right then you wont get any points.
The code is not being judged. During the competition random people just come to your computer,
put their usb in and you run your program through the file that they give you.
You are judged according to your output

Read full topic

item.title: Some contest programs
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Finished Problem 2 on the contest thing

public static boolean isValidNumber(long value) {
	List<Integer> addUps = new ArrayList<Integer>();
	char[] characters = String.valueOf(value).toCharArray();
	for (int i = 1; i < characters.length + 1; i++) {
		char c = characters[i - 1];
		if (i % 2 == 0) {
			int convert = Integer.parseInt("" + c) * 2;
			int v = 0;
			for (char c2 : String.valueOf(convert).toCharArray())
				v += Integer.parseInt("" + c2);
			addUps.add(v);
		} else addUps.add(Integer.parseInt("" + c));
	}
	int complete = 0;
	for (int i : addUps) complete += i;
	return complete % 10 == 0;
}

Tried an attempt at the gene mutation: I couldn’t understand 100% of what they were asking, but I believe I’m close

public static int[][] generateChromosomes(int length) {
	int[][] values = new int[length][25];
	for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
		for (int j = 0; j < 25; j++) {
			values[i][j] += new Random().nextBoolean() ? 0 : 1;
		}
	}
	return values;
}

public static List<Object[]> conceiveChild(int length) {
	int[][] parents1 = generateChromosomes(length);
	int[][] parents2 = generateChromosomes(length);
	int[][][][] children = new int[2][2][length][25];
	
	for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
		for (int j = 0; j < 25; j++) {
			if (j != 0 && j != 24) {
				if (parents1[i][j] != parents2[i][j]) { //if the genes on the index are not the same
					int old = parents1[i][j];
					children[0][0][i][j] = parents2[i][j]; //swaps the genes
					children[1][0][i][j] = old; //swaps the genes
				}
			}
			if (new Random().nextBoolean()) {
				children[0][1][i][j] = new Random().nextBoolean() ? 0 : 1;
				children[1][1][i][j] = new Random().nextBoolean() ? 0 : 1;
			}
		}
	}
	List<Object[]> conceived = new ArrayList<Object[]>();
	for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
		int mutations = 0;
		String childBinary = "";
		for (int j = 0; j < 25; j++) {
			int originalGene = children[0][0][i][j];
			int mutatedGene = children[0][1][i][j];
			if (originalGene != mutatedGene) {
				mutations++;
			}
			childBinary += children[0][0][i][j];
		}
		double chance = (double) (mutations) / 25;
		conceived.add(new Object[] {childBinary, chance});
	}
	return conceived;
}

Results of the Gene tests:

Child Chromosomes		Chance
-------------------------	------

0000001000000000001011100	48%
0001001000001000100001010	36%
0000000001000001100000000	36%
0110000100001000001010000	28%
0000000100010000000100000	32%
0000101101000010000111000	36%
0010111100101000100110100	44%
0000100000000000000010100	48%
0100001000000100000001010	52%
0000000000100010010100100	40%
